drawingAnalyzer.title: Drawing Analysis
drawingAnalyzer.cameraDescription: Take a photo of a drawing to analyze
drawingAnalyzer.noFile: Please select a file or take a photo
drawingAnalyzer.fileTooLarge: File is too large. Maximum size is 5MB
drawingAnalyzer.invalidFileType: Invalid file type. Please upload a JPG, PNG, or JPEG file
drawingAnalyzer.instructions: Instructions: Review the drawing and check all that apply. Multiple selections are allowed.

hands.text: Are the hands missing, cut off, or extremely small?
hands.tip:
Potential indicator of helplessness, loss of agency, or abuse.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: PMC9221832 - NCBI

arms.text: Are the arms disproportionately large or used aggressively?
arms.tip:
May indicate exposure to physical aggression or internalized anger.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: [Lev-Wiesel & Liraz, 2007]

neck.text: Is the neck missing or the head detached from the body?
neck.tip:
Associated with trauma, disassociation, or abuse.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Allen & Tussey, 2012; Dillenburger, 2005

legs.text: Are the legs tightly closed or crossed unnaturally?
legs.tip:
May reflect sexual discomfort, shame, or trauma.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Allen & Tussey, 2012; Sidun & Rosenthal, 1987

genitalia.text: Is there genitalia depicted or suggested (e.g., emphasis, exposure, or detail)?
genitalia.tip:
A significant red flag, especially if unsolicited or highly detailed.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Identifying Sexually Abused Children Through Art

face.text: Is the face sad, crying, or lacks eyes or mouth?
face.tip:
Can suggest emotional withdrawal or trauma.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Koppitz's Emotional Indicators

mouth.text: Is the mouth shown sealed, sewn, or missing entirely?
mouth.tip:
May symbolize silencing or fear of speaking out.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Draw-A-Person Test interpretations

ears.text: Are the ears overly large or exaggerated?
ears.tip:
Could indicate hypervigilance or alertness to danger.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: PMC9221832 - NCBI

house.text: Is the house missing doors or windows?
house.tip:
Often interpreted as a lack of escape or isolation.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Scott, University of Wisconsin Study

elements.text: Are there elements like dark clouds, excessive rain, or bars on the house/tree?
elements.tip:
Symbolize fear, threat, or emotional confinement.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: DAP and HTP indicators

trees.text: Are trees drawn without roots or very small in size?
trees.tip:
Might indicate a lack of grounding, support, or identity.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Generating Psychological Analysis Tables

phallic.text: Are there phallic shapes (e.g., elongated wedges, circles, weapons)?
phallic.tip:
May unconsciously reflect sexual exposure or confusion.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Malchiodi, 1990; Sidun & Rosenthal, 1987

colors.text: Is there excessive use of red, black, or dark colors?
colors.tip:
Common in drawings of children with high emotional distress.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Frontiers in Psychology, 2020

hearts.text: Are there multiple hearts, wedges, or sad emojis/emoticons?
hearts.tip:
May represent self-loathing or distorted affection.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: UW-Whitewater study

isolation.text: Does the drawing show isolation (e.g., child far from family figures or alone)?
isolation.tip:
Associated with emotional neglect or detachment.
‚úîÔ∏è Reference: Draw-A-Person and HTP evaluations
